meanings.definition: To leave a place or position
meanings.sent1: After finishing his work, he is vacating the office.
meanings.sent2: She will be vacating her seat on the bus at the next stop.
meanings.sent3: The cat is vacating the sunny spot on the window sill for the dog.
meanings.sent4: The departing ship seemed to be vacating the harbor reluctantly.
meanings.sent5: The students were vacating the classroom in a hurry after the bell rang.

meanings.definition: To make a place empty or available
meanings.sent1: The guests are vacating the hotel rooms for the next group.
meanings.sent2: Please start vacating the area for the construction work to begin.
meanings.sent3: The magician was vacating the stage for the next performer in a puff of smoke.
meanings.sent4: The melting snow was vacating the streets, revealing the green grass underneath.
meanings.sent5: The workers were vacating the warehouse, leaving it ready for the new shipment.

meanings.definition: To give up possession or occupancy
meanings.sent1: The tenant will be vacating the apartment at the end of the month.
meanings.sent2: The company is vacating the old building to move to a new location.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was vacating its nest in the tree for a bigger one.
meanings.sent4: She felt like vacating her worries and embracing a carefree attitude.
meanings.sent5: The explorer was vacating his claim on the land, allowing others to settle there.
